title: Freeport teen shot by cousin over the weekend
content:
FREEPORT (WREX) -
Freeport Police say a 17-year-old boy was accidentally shot by his cousin over the weekend.
Police say three juveniles were in a bedroom at a home in the 1100 block of South State Ave. in Freeport Saturday afternoon when they found a handgun.
Police say a 15-year-old boy was playing with the gun when it accidentally went off, shooting the 17-year-old in the abdomen. The two boys are cousins.
The shooting victim was taken to FHN Memorial Hospital by family members. Officers were called to the hospital, where they conducted interviews to investigate the shooting.
The victim was airlifted to OSF St. Anthony Medical Center in Rockford for treatment. His condition was listed as critical but stable as of Sunday.
The 15-year-old teen was arrested and taken to the Kane County Juvenile Detention Center. He has been charged with two counts of aggravated unlawful use of a firearm and one county of reckless discharge of a firearm. He is scheduled to appear in court Monday morning.
